intro: Thibaudia ocanensis, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, violet-colored flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 cm and prefers well-drained soil and bright, indirect light. Its ornamental value makes it a popular houseplant, though it requires careful watering to avoid root rot.
